message.body: errw arent we having a multitude of decentralized social networks? Why another one?
errw arent we having a multitude of decentralized social networks? Why another one?

and why do we need social networks at all after all? we did not manage to solve problems (of the type that social networks aim to solve) with existing ones. We just exposed personal info of who knows whom. In very unreliable fashion.

OK lets talk then. What would be the purpose of having yet another profile on yet another soc.net? I already have an ID here, a blog, a web site. I can express myself. OK Some of these things can be a bit simpler so people can use them easier. True.

What would be a purpose to build yet another FB? G+? Diaspora? gnusocial? We've seen it all already. And it does not fit the purpose and has long genesis from early days of net (newsgroups). You are skillful but be creative. We need something better than soc.net concept. 0net allows me to 'bookmark' friends webs that is enough social for me.

vethit if you wish really to see what are people speaking their minds, by now there shall be several of this kind for example http://www.confessions.net/ the fact is we are not interested for most of this stuff except if you are professional researching the subject

even this chat is enough social for me. The fact is that as any chat sooner or later it may become full of people and then you need to make it by topic. SO back to IRC - by topic discussion. Or.. do you believe that Redit is social network ? How do you see it?
